p: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a common health problem in older subjects. It is defined as abnormalities in kidney structure or function, present for > 3 months, with implications for health. 1 Although questionable, it is usually diagnosed based on decreased estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) in clinical practice. The prevalence of CKD defined as eGFR < 60 mL/min/1.73m 2 in the older generation is generally high, but varies greatly (11–37%) depending on the population assessed and the method of GFR estimation used. 2– 5
